1.name: Hawaii Kalbi
1.instructions:
1. Rinse the beef ribs under water to get rid of any bone fragments when the butcher cut through the bones. Set aside the meat.
 2. In a large bowl mix together the water, shoyu, brown sugar, mirin, rice wine, sesame oil, black pepper, ginger, sliced green onions, finely grated pear, finely grated kiwi, and minced garlic. To save time, you can also put all of these ingredients in a blender.
 3. Either put the marinade and meat in a large enough container or ziploc bag. Make sure the meat is covered in the marinade. Cover or seal and let marinade in the fridge overnight. The longer the better, marinade up to three nights.
 4. Broil on high to desired doneness.
ingredients: 3 lbs Kalbi short rib of beef

2.name: Mochiko chicken
2.instructions:
5. Combine all ingredients and marinate overnight.
 6. Deep fry until brown.

3.name: Rafute (Okinawan braised pork belly)
3.instructions:
1. Wash pork belly.
 2. Place pork belly in a large pot (skin side up). 
 3. Add cold water and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute and discard the water.
 4. Rinse off scum and foam from pork. Rinse the pot, put the pork belly back in the pot, and fill it with cold water.
 5. Bring the pot to a boil and skim off scum and foam. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook uncovered for at least 1 to 1.5 hours. Leave the pot uncovered. As water evaporates, add in boiling water enough to keep pork fully covered.
 6. Boil 4 cups of water in a separate smaller pot. Once boiling, add katsuobushi. Let it simmer for 15 seconds. Turn off the heat and let katsuobushi seep in the pot. Set aside. Alternatively, you can use Hondashi soup stock to make this broth.
 7. Slice the ginger and cut it into thin strips. Soak them in water for 10-15 minutes to remove some spiciness. Drain well and set aside for garnishing later.
 8. After 1 to 1.5 hours of cooking pork belly, transfer the pork to a plate and cover it with foil to keep it from drying out. Let it cool until you can touch to slice, about 5 minutes. 
 9. Once the meat is cool enough for you to handle, slice meat into 2.3cm thickness. Add the pork belly slices to a pot.
 10. Strain the katsuobushi dashi into the pot.
 11. In the pot, add awamori, black sugar, and soy sauce. Mix the liquid and make sure the pork belly is covered with the sauce. 
 12. Bring to a gentle simmer and skim off any foam. Place a lid on the pot and cook over medium-low heat for 2 hours. Cook until the pork is very tender and the skin/fat is gelatinous. 
 13. Serve the pork belly on a plate and pour some braising liquid. Garnish with ginger slices.
ingredients: 3 lbs Pork belly, boneless, skin on
3 cups Katsuobushi (dried bonito flakes) or Hondashi soup stock
1.5 cups awamori(okinawan distilled liquor, substitute with sake or vodka)
0.75 cups Black sugar(substitute with muscovado sugar)

4.name: Rotisserie Ham
4.instructions:
1. Bring everything to boil.
 2. Lower heat to medium, reduce by â…“ about 4 to 6 minutes.
 3. Remove from heat. Stir in butter.
 4. Brush ham. Keep brushing while cooking.
 5. Ham needs to reach 140f internal temp at thickest part.

5.name: Turkey Meatballs
5.instructions:
1. Dice the onion and mince the garlic
 2. Mix things together
 3. Make balls
 4. Bake

6.name: Korokke
6.instructions:
To Make Korokke Patties
 1. Peel and cut the potatoes in quarters. In a large pot, put water and potatoes, and bring them to a boil. Cook potatoes until a skewer goes through the potato easily, about 15-20 minutes. Drain.
 2. Move the pot back to the stove. On low heat, shake the pot so that the remaining moisture will completely evaporate (but donâ€™t burn them).
 3. Turn off the heat and mash the potatoes. Unlike the typical mashed potatoes, you donâ€™t have to mash them completely. I like leaving some small chunks for texture. Set aside.
 4. Meanwhile, chop onion, carrot, and mushrooms finely.
 5. In a large skillet, heat oil on medium-high heat. SautÃ© onion until soft.
 6. Add carrot and shiitake mushrooms and cook until they are soft.
 7. Add the meat and break it up with a wooden spoon. When the meat is cooked through, add salt, white pepper, and black pepper. Remove from the heat.
 8. Add the meat mixture to the mashed potatoes in the large pot, leaving the cooking liquid behind as we don't want to introduce too much moisture to the mixture.
 9. Add an egg. Mix it all together until everything is well combined.
 10. While the mixture is still warm, but not hot, start shaping the mixture into Korokke patties. Cover and let the Korokke patties rest in the fridge for 30 minutes (Do not skip!). TIP: Resting and cooling down the patties prevents the croquettes from exploding while deep frying. The cold patties in the hot oil will not release any steam; therefore, croquettes will not explode in the oil. If you skip this process and the patties are still warm, the temperature of the patties will go up and start to steam, which will then puncture a hole in the panko coating and explode. It also helps the ingredients to meld together.
 To Bread the Korokke
 After 30 minutes, coat each patty with flour, egg, and panko, in that order.
 Cover with plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
 To Deep Fry
 Deep fry Korokke until they are golden brown. The inside is already cooked, so all you need to do is to fry them until nicely brown.
 Transfer Korokke to paper towels and let the oil be absorbed in the paper. Serve immediately with Tonkatsu Sauce.
 To Store
 You can store the leftover in an airtight container and freeze up to a month. To reheat, put frozen or half defrosted korokke on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil or parchment paper and bake at 350ÂºF (180ÂºC) for 15 minutes or until inside is warm.

7.name: Butter Chicken
7.instructions:
1. Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil, butter, and onions until golden, about 3-4 minutes. Add ginger and garlic and let cook for 30 seconds. Stir so it doesnâ€™t burn.
 2. Add chicken, tomato paste, and spices. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until everything is cooked.
 3. Add heavy cream and simmer for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally serve over rice.
ingredients: 1-1/2 lbs Boneless chicken breast, cut into Â¾ inch chunks
4 Tbsp Tomato paste (or 8oz can tomato sauce)

8.name: Buttermilk Fried Chicken Tenders
8.instructions:
1. Place chicken in a ziplock bag and pour the buttermilk into the bag. Squeeze air out and seal the bag. Let marinade in the fridge for 15-30 minutes.
 2. In a shallow bowl combine the panko, flour, baking powder, and spices.
 3. Remove the chicken strips from the buttermilk with a fork, shake off excess buttermilk, and dredge in the breadcrumb mixture to coat on all sides.
 4. Preheat air fryer to 350F if necessary.
 5. Put the chicken in the air fryer and air fry for 10-12 minutes, pause after 4 minutes and brush chicken with melted butter then turn it over and brush butter on the other side. Cook until internal temperature reads 175F and the chicken tenders are golden brown and crispy.
 6. Serve right away with your favorite dipping sauce.
ingredients: 3 Tbsp Melted butter, or oil spray

9.name: Meat Jun
9.instructions:
1. Combine the first four ingredients; mix well until sugar has dissolved.
 2. Add meat to the marinade and cover with a plastic wrap or towel. Let marinade in the fridge for 1-2 hours.
 3. Afer the meat has marinated, whisk eggs in a large bowl. Add enough flour to a plate to dredge the meat in.
 4. Heat and oil a non stick pan over medium heat.
 5. Dredge the meat first in flour, then cover it in the whisked eggs.
 6. Quickly transfer the meat to the pan.
 7. Repeat the same process unti the pan in slightly full.
 8. Cook the meat for 1-2 minutes or until the bottom becomes lightly golden brown.
 9. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
 10. Remove from the pan after all sides have been cooked.
 11. For dipping sauce, combine the remaining shoyu, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and gochujang or chili oil. Whisk to continue.
 12. Cut meat into thin strips and serve with dipping sauce on the side. If you made a large batch, you can freeze it for up to one month.

10.name: Loco moco
10.instructions:
1. Chop onion
 2. Combine about 2/3 cup of chopped onion into the ground beef
 3. Add black pepper, garlic powder, panko to ground beef and mix thoroughly
 4. Knead the meat to mix
 5. Shape about 5 patties with meat mixture
 6. Fry patties in a frying pan. Add mushrooms halfway through.
 7. Saute the rest of the onions
 8. Make the loco moco gravy
 9. Fry the eggs over easy
 10.
ingredients: 1 lb Ground beef Black pepper, to taste
2 Button mushrooms, sliced Loco moco gravy

11.name: Spam Cabbage
11.instructions:
1. Fry spam until crispy
 2. Add garlic and fry until crispy
 3. Add cabbage, shoyu, onion, pepper, water, and oyster sauce. Boil until cabbage is done cooking
 4. Drizzle oyster sauce
ingredients: 0 Pepper (enough to make lots of black spots)

12.name: Kalua Pig Cabbage
12.instructions:
1. Brown the Kalua Pork, and cook with onions until onions are glossy
 2. Add cabbage, shoyu, pepper, water, and garlic. Boil until the cabbage is soft.
 3. Add red chili pepper flakes when eating.
ingredients: 0 Pepper (enough to make lots of black spots)

13.name: Grandmaâ€™s Japanese Mabo Tofu
13.instructions:
1. Mix everything except tofu and beef in a bowl.
 2. Brown ground beef.
 3. Add sauce and simmer in pot.
 4. Rinse tofu and add in pot, stir to break up tofu into smaller pieces.
 5. Add chicken stock or water as needed and salt to taste.
ingredients: 1 cup Chicken stock or water (1 tsp paste)

14.name: Zippyâ€™s Copycat Chili
14.instructions:
1. Pulse the pochos sausage in a food processor until it matches consistency of ground meat. (Throw the onion, celery, and bell pepper in a food processor).
 2. Saute onion, celery, and bell pepper in a little bit of oil until soft.
 3. Add ground beef and pochos and cook until just browned.
 4. Add chili powder, cumin, oregano, and galic. Saute until fragrant.
 5. Add tomato paste, chicken broth, drained beans, worcestershire sauce, and bay leaves. Give a little stir.
 6. Close pot and cook.
 7. Remove bay leaves and serve.

15.name: Da Bes Hawaiian Beef Stew
15.instructions:
1. Heat oil in large pot. Working in small batches in a single layer, brown the beef, making sure each piece is thoroughly carmelized. When all the meat is brown, set aside in a bowl.
 2. In the hot pan, add the chopped onion and brown, about 3 minutes.
 3. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
 4. Add the flour and cook 1 minute.
 5. Add 2 pounds of browned beef back into the pot. 
 6. Season to taste with salt and coarse ground black pepper.
 7. Add in bay leaf.
 8. Add water so that the browned beef is just covered.
 9. Bring to a boil, then turn heat down to medium-low.
 10. Simmer covered for 2 hours.
 11. Add the carrots, potatoes, celery, diced tomato and tomato sauce and simmer until vegetables are tender.
 12. Finish it with some fresh cracked black pepper, serve with hot rice and/or poi.

16.name: Beef Stew with Red Wine
16.instructions:
1. Combine the salt, rosemary, thyme, marjoram, paprika, and black pepper in a small bowl.
 2. Cut any large pieces of stew meat into smaller bit-size pieces, if necessary.
 3. Heat the oil in a large thick pot over medium-high heat. Add about half of the meat to the pan, or as much as you can without overcrowding. Sprinkle 2 teaspoons of the spice mixture over the meat and saute the beef until nicely browned. Use a slotted spoot to transfer the beef to a dish and set aside. Repeat with the remaining beef, adding additional oil if needed, and season with 2 more teaspoons of the spice mixture. Reserve remaining spice mixture for later.
 4. Add additional oil to the pan if needed and add the onion, celery, garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened.
 5. Add the tomato paste and stir until well combined.
 6. Add the red wine and increase the heat to bring mixture to a boil.
 7. Add the beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, remaining spice mix and the bay leaf.
 8. Add the beef and all the juices that have accumulated back to the pot and bring to a boil.
 9. Reduce heat to LOW, cover, and simmer for 1.5 hours, or until the beef is fork tender.
 10. Add the potatoes and carrots and raise the heat to bring the liquid to a boil.
 11. Reduce the head to LOW, cover and simmer for another 30 to 40 minutes until the veggies are fork tender.
 12. Stir in the frozen peas and parsley.
 13. Combine the water and cornstarch in a measuring cup or small bowl and stir into the beef stew. Continue cooking uncovered, until thickened.
 14. Discard the bay leaf before serving.
ingredients: 1 cup Diced white or yellow onion
1 cup Medium to full-bodied red wine (Cabernet, Zinfandel, or Merlot)
1 lb Baby yellow or red potatoes, halved and quartered
1 cup Frozen peas, no need to thaw

17.name: Three Cheese Eggplant Lasagna
17.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Coat a sheet pan with cooking spray.
 2. Trim the stem end from the eggplants. Cut the eggplants lengthwise into 1/2 inch thick slices.
 3. Brush 2 teaspoons of olive oil over the eggplant slices and season with salt and pepper.
 4. Place the eggplant in the oven and cook for 15-20 minutes or until tender and browned. If there's any excess moisture on your cooked eggplant, blot it dry with a paper towel.
 5. While the eggplant is cooking, prepare the sauce. Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
 6. Add the ground beef and season with salt and pepper to taste.
 7. Cook for 5-6 minutes, breaking the meat up with a spatula, until beef is browned and cooked through.
 8. Add the onion and cook for another 3-4 minutes or until softened. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
 9. Add the marinara sauce and bring to a simmer; cook for 5 minutes.
 10. Place the ricotta cheese, Italian seasoning, egg, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper in a bowl. Mix until well combined.
 11. Coat a 2 or 3 quart baking dish with cooking spray.
 12. Place 1/4 of the sauce in the bottom of the dish. Add 1/3 of the eggplant slices on top. Spread 1/3 of the ricotta mixture over the eggplant then top with 1/3 of the mozzarella cheese. Repeat the layers, ending with the mozzarella cheese.
 13. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley, then let stand for 7-10 minutes. Cut into slices, then serve.

18.name: Fettuccine alfredo
18.instructions:
14. Cook pasta. Save water to thin out sauce.
 15. Heat butter in large pan. Add garlic, cook 1-2 minutes.
 16. Stir in heavy cream.
 17. Reduce cream 5-8 minutes.
 18. Add half parmesan cheese, whisk well till melted.
 19. Add pasta to sauce.
 20. Add remaining cheese.
 21. Add pasta water to sauce if the sauce is too thick.

19.name: Spaghetti Sauce
19.instructions:
1. Season ground beef with salt and pepper. 
 2. In a large skillet, add the beef and chopped onion and brown.  Drain excess grease. 
 3. Add tomato sauce, tomato paste, Italian seasoning, parsley, garlic powder, crushed red pepper, worcestershire, and sugar to the skillet. 
 4. Stir well to combine and bring to a boil. Add water and stir well. 
 5. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Add chopped basil before serving, if desired.
 6. This sauce tastes great in Spaghetti Pie, Million Dollar Spaghetti, Slow Cooker Lasagna and Instant Pot Spaghetti.
ingredients: 0 Salt and black pepper, to taste
0 Crushed red pepper flakes, to taste

20.name: Stuffed Shells with Ricotta & Spinach
20.instructions:
7. Bring pot of salted water to boil. Add spinach and cook until just wilted, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Use slotted spoon to transfer spinach to colander to drain and cool slightly. (Keep water boiling). Place drained spinach leaves in a kitchen towel and wring out any excess liquid.
 8. Add pasta to the pot of boiling water and cook until al dente, 10 minutes or 1 minute less than package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
 9. In large bowl, combine the ricotta with the pesto. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Roughly chop wilted spinach, and add to the mixture, stirring until combined.
 10. Chop 3 cloves of garlic. In large skillet over medium-high head, warm 2 tablespoons olive oil. When oil is hot, add garlic and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Add marinara sauce and pinch of chile flakes. Bring sauce to a simmer, and cook until the flavors combine, 6 minutes. Season to taste with salt.
 11. Stuff each shell with 1 tablespoon of filling. Nestle the filled shells into the marinara sauce. Cover and simmer until the shells are warmed through, 5 minutes. Pick the basil, discard the stems, and tear the leaves.
 12. Spoon the shells into shallow bowls, sprinkle with Parmesan and torn basil leaves, and serve warm.

21.name: Homemade Cheeseburger Macaroni
21.instructions:
1. Brown the ground beef until no pink remains
 2. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes
 3. Stir in tomato paste, seasonings and flour
 4. Pour in milk and broth and stir
 5. Stir in macaroni
 6. Bring to a boil then reduce to medium-low, cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes or until macaroni is done. For al dente, check after 9 minutes.
 7. Stir in the cheddar cheese until melted
 8. Serve immediately garnished with some chopped fresh parsley if desired
ingredients: 2 cups Dried whole wheat elbow macaroni

22.name: Omurice
22.instructions:
1. Cube chicken, then marinate in shoyu.
 2. Break eggs, mix with salt and cream.
 3. Brown onions in oil on medium heat.
 4. Stir-fry chicken until no raw sides.
 5. Add rice and break with spatula.
 6. Warm rice, then add ketchup and oyster sauce. Cook till even color and ketchup starting to carmelize.
 7. Add black pepper to taste. Plate rice.
 8. Cook omelette and put on top of rice.

23.name: Miso Glazed Japanese Eggplant
23.instructions:
1. Slice eggplant.
 2. Put eggplant in colander, sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 30 minutes to reduce bitterness.
 3. Mix miso, mirin, and sugar in bowl. Set aside.
 4. Heat oil and fry eggplants on medium heat until soft.
 5. Turn heat to low. Add miso mixture and stir quickly.
 6. Remove from heat, serve hot.

24.name: Lionâ€™s mane crab cakes
24.instructions:
1. Shred mushroom in bowl.
 2. In large bowl, combine egg, mayo, onion, worchestershire, and paprika, dijon mustard, parsley, salt, and pepper. Mix until fully incorporated.
 3. Mix in mushroom until fully incorporated.
 4. Mix in panko.
 5. Form mixture into 3-4 patties (about Â½ to Â¾ inch)
 6. Heat oil in pan on med/high heat.
 7. Cook patties about 2-3 minutes per side. Should be golden brown and cooked throughout.

25.name: Roasted Beef Tenderloin with Beer Horseradish Sauce and Pilsner Mushrooms
25.instructions:
Beer Horseradish Sauce
 1. Use small saucepan, combine the pilsner and horseradish. Bring to a low boil and reduce to a simmer.
 2. Simmer for 5 minutes so that the alcohol cooks out, and then remvoe from heat. Let it cool for about 10 minutes.
 3. In a small bowl, wish together the beer and horseradish mixture, sour cream, salt and black pepper until smooth and creamy. Transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate until you are ready to serve.
 Roasted Beef Tenderloin and Pilsner Mushrooms
 4. Preheat oven to 475F.
 5. Heat a large cast iron skillet over medium high heat. Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper. Once pan is hot, add beef to pan. Sear beef on all sides. Remove beef.
 6. Lower heat and then add mushrooms. Cook for 4-6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
 7. Add the beer and bring to a low boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and evaporate beer.
 8. Add the beef back to the pan and place entire pan into the oven. Roast for 45-50 minutes until center is 120-125F for medium rare. 
 9. Remove pan from heat and remove beef from pan. Let the beef rest for 15 minutes, slice as desired.
 10. Serve with sauce and mushrooms.
ingredients: 00 Roasted Beef Tenderloin and Pilsner Mushrooms
2.5 cup Crimini mushrooms, halved and quartered

26.name: Comfort-food Breakfast Burrito
26.instructions:
1. Dice onion, tomatoes, and jalapenos
 2. Crumble and fry pork sausage. Stir and separate meat so it will fry into small little pieces. Remove from heat, and drain excess grease.
 3. Place drained sausage in a frying pan, and add onion, jalapenos, and tomatoes. Heat on medium temperature until sausage and vegetables are heated through, stir frequently.
 4. Measure 2 cups of eggs and beat. Add the eggs to the pan with the sausage mixture. When cooked, remove from heat.
 5. To assemble, place two tablespoons of the sausage and egg mixture onto 1 tortilla, tear each slice of American cheese into two even portions, then place the cheese on top of the sausage mixture, and roll the tortilla.
 6. If you make these all ahead of time, you can wrap them in plastic to store them in the fridge or freezer, and then heat them up in the microwave for a minute or two.
 7. Serve with your favorite taco or picante sauce. You can also serve it with avocado and sour cream.

27.name: Whole Wheat Burger/Hot Dog Buns
27.instructions:
8. Place all ingredients in order according to bread machine
 9. Run bread machine for dough
 10. Dump out onto lightly floured surface
 11. Divide into 8-10 pieces (8 hamburger, 10 hotdog)
 12. Shape into hot dog or burger bun
 13. Place on greased cookie sheets, cover; let rise 30 to 40 minutes
 14. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 12 to 15 minutes until golden
 15. Cool on wire racks
ingredients: 1 Tbsp Active dry yeast (or instant yeast)

28.name: Sourdough bread (1 lb loaf)
28.instructions:
Mix together into bread machine.
 Use french bread setting
 After 10 min of mixing, check dough consistency.
 Add water as needed.
ingredients: 0 *Replace water with oil for crustier bread

29.name: Banana Bread
29.instructions:
1. Melt butter.
 2. Combine eggs, honey, vanilla extract, melted butter in a large bowl and whisk until combined.
 3. Add salt, baking soda, and flour. Whisk well.
 4. Add bananas and mix to desired chunkiness.
 5. Add sour cream.
 6. Sprinkle cinnamon on top of the mix.
 7. Grease 1 large loaf pan or cupcake pan.
 8. Bake at 350 F for 1 hour. Check for doneness with a toothpick.

30.name: Japanese Egg Sandwich (Tamago Sando)
30.instructions:
1. Put eggs in a medium saucepan and add enough water to cover by one inch. Bring it to a boil on medium heat. Once boiling, cook for 12 minutes.
 2. Transfer eggs to iced water to stop the cooking. Let them cool completely and peel the eggshells.
 3. Transfer peel eggs to a bowl and mash with a fork. Try to mash the egg whites into small, same-sized pieces.
 4. Add sugar and salt.
 5. Add black pepper and milk. Taste and add more salt and pepper if needed.
 6. Add mayo and mix very well.
 7. Spread butter on the bread. Evenly distribute the egg salad on one slice of bread.
 8. Put another slice of bread on top, and place the sandwich between two plates to compress slightly. Set aside for 5 minutes.
 9. Cut the bread crust off.
 10. Cut the sandwich in half and eat

31.name: Creamy Ham Potato and Corn Chowder
31.instructions:
1. In a large pot, melt 1.5 Tbsp butter over medium heat. 
 2. Add onion, carrot, and celery and sute until tender, about 4 minutes. 
 3. Add chicken broth, potatoes, oregano, thyme, and bay leaf and season with salt and pepper to taste.
 4. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to medium, cover with lid and allow to cook, stirring occasionally until potatoes are nearly tender, about 15 minutes.
 5. Add in ham and corn and cook until potatoes are tender, about 5 minutes longer.
 6. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, melt remaining 4 Tbsp butter over medium heat. Add flour and cook mixture, stirring constantly, 1 Â½ minutes.
 7. While whisking, slowly add in milk, and whisk vigorously to smooth lumps, season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring mixture to a boil and allow to thicken, whisking constantly.
 8. Remove from heat, stir in sour cream or heavy cream. Pour and stir milk mixture into soup (once potatoes are tender). Serve warm and topped with bacon and chives.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Sour cream or heavy cream

32.name: Butternut Squash Soup
32.instructions:
1. Dice the onion.
 2. Mince the garlic. 
 3. SauteÃ© the onions and garlic until the onion is shiny.
 4. Roughly chop the carrot.
 5. Roughly chop the apple.
 6. Peel, seed, and cube the butternut squash. If the squash is hard, you can microwave it for a couple of minutes to soften.
 7. Add the chicken broth, carrot, apple, butternut squash, sage, cayenne, cinnamon, and nutmeg to the pot. Simmer for 20-30 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
 8. Remove and discard the sage. 
 9. Lower the heat and add coconut milk.
 10. Use an immersion blender to pureÃ© the soup until smooth. Be careful to prevent splashing the hot soup during this step.
 11. Add salt and pepper to taste when serving.

33.name: Curry Udon
33.instructions:
1. Thinly slice onion and green onions.
 2. Chop carrots and potatoes into small cubes.
 3. SauteÃ© onion in a pot until translucent.
 4. Add ground beef and cook until it is almost browned.
 5. Add dashi, carrots, and potatoes. Cook until vegetables are tender. 
 6. Start boiling water in a large pot to cook the udon noodles.
 7. Once vegetables are tender, turn the heat to low.
 8. Put the curry roux in a ladle or large spoon, and use the hot stock to dissolve the roux into the soup.
 9. Once roux has dissolved, turn off heat.
 10. Add shoyu and mix well. 
 11. When the water is boiling, cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions.
 12. After noodles are done cooking, divide them into two bowls.
 13. Pour curry soup over the udon noodles.
 14. Top with green onions and serve immediately.

34.name: Ozoni
34.instructions:
12. Peel and slice daikon and carrots.
 13. Bring dashi to boil in pot, then add chicken. Cook 5-7 minutes.
 14. Skim foam and fat on surface.
 15. Remove chicken, leave on side.
 16. Add daikon and carrots and boil on medium until soft.
 17. Blanche spinach in sauce pan, then put in cold water.
 18. Add miso to soup. (3 tbsp at a time, to taste).
 19. Add tofu.
 20. Toast mochi.
 21. Put together.

35.name: Potato Ham Chowder
35.instructions:
1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add bacon and cook until crispy.
 2. Melt butter in pot over medium heat.
 3. Add garlic and onion. Cook until translucent. Stir in corn and thyme, cook for 1-2 minutes.
 4. Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute.
 5. Gradually whisk in milk stirring constantly until thickened about 1-2 minutes.
 6. Stir in potatoes.
 7. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 12-15 minutes.
 8. Stir in ham, salt and pepper to taste. Add more milk if chowder is too thick.
 9. Garnish with bacon.

36.name: Spicy Tan Tan Ramen
36.instructions:
1. Add all ingredients for tare and whisk until smooth. Set aside.
 2. In a medium pot, combine water, milk, and chicken powder. Cover and bring to light simmer. Watch carefully, itâ€™s easy to boil over. Also, bring another pot of water to boil.
 3. Heat a large pan over high heat, add chili oil, garlic and ginger. Stir fry for 30 seconds or until you can smell aroma, then add chili bean paste and oyster sauce. Stir fry for 45 seconds to 1 minute then add ground pork. Break down pork and stir fry with sauce, about 1 minute. Splash rice wine and stir fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until thereâ€™s no moisture and pork is fully cooked. Remove from heat and keep warm.
 4. Add generous amount of salt into boiling water then add bok choy and blanch for 1 minute. Remove from water, drain and set aside. Add handful of beansprounts and blanch for 2 minutes. Remove from water, drain and set aside.
 5. Drop noodles into now-empty boiling water and cook. Meanwhile, combine half of tare and half of hot broth in serving bowl.
 6. Drain noodles well and add into bowl. Top ramen with beansprouts, bok choy, stir-fried pork, extra chili oil if you like, ramen egg, chopped green onions, sesame seeds and sansyo powder.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp Chili oil or regular cooking oil
1 Tbsp Toban djian (Chinese chili bean paste)

37.name: Miso Soup
37.instructions:
7. Bring water to a boil and add dashi powder
 8. Add small daikon, boil until daikon is soft and translucent (about 5 minutes)
 9. Turn down heat, add tofu. Cook for 3 more minutes.
 10. Add miso and mix until dissolved
 11. Turn off heat, add negi when serving
ingredients: 4 Tbsp Awase miso (half white, half red)

38.name: Garlic Broccolini
38.instructions:
12. Rinse broccolini under cool water and shake off excess water. Trim about Â½ inch off the bottom of the stems.
 13. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high head until shimmering. Add broccolini and saute until broccolini is bright green and some stems and tops of the florets are lightly charred, 5-7 minutes
 14. Add garlic, salt, and red pepper flakes. Continue to saute until the garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
 15. Add the water, cover and cook until broccolini is vibrant green and crisp-tender, 1 to 2 minutes.
 16. Serve immediately, with lemon wedges.

39.name: Hawaii Mac Salad
39.instructions:
1. Cook macaroni and drain. 
 2. Combine mayo, milk, vinegar, carrots and sugar in a bowl and mix.
 3. Add macaroni to the bowl and mix gently.
 4. Add salt and pepper to taste.
 5. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. 
 6. Serve cold with a splash of shoyu.

40.name: Stir-fry garlic green beans
40.instructions:
7. Boil beans, let water drain on paper towel.
 8. Mix shoyu and wine. Prepare garlic, ginger and red pepper flakes.
 9. Heat pan until one drop of water evaporates in 1-2 sec
 10. Swirl oil in pan
 11. Stir fry garlic and ginger for 8 seconds. Add green beans, toss in shoyu and wine, cook until desired texture/consistency.

41.name: French Green Beans with Butter Sauce and Crispy Leeks
41.instructions:
1. For Fried Leeks; Heat 1 inch oil to 350F in a heavy pot. Meanwhile, in a bowl, stir flour with Â¼ tsp salt and pepper. 
 2. In another bowl, pour buttermilk. Coat leek rounds in buttermilk, then dredge in flour.
 3. Fry leeks until golden, about 1 minute.
 4. For butter sauce; place white wine, vinegar, celery,chopped leaks, remaining Â¼ tsp salt and pepper, and sugar in a pot over medium heat. Bring to a boil and cook until liquid is reduced by two-thirds.
 5. Whisk in butter until fully incorporated.
 6. Transfer steamed green beans to platter, drizzle with butter sauce and top with fried leeks

42.name: Hasselback Potato Gratin
42.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Lightly grease a 3 quart baking dish. Combine onions, cream, garlic, thyme, rosemary, 1 â…” cups Gruyere, and â…” cup parmesan in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
 2. Arrange potato slices vertically in prepared baking dish. Pour cream mixture over potatoes, making sure some of the mixture goes betweenthe potatoes. Cover with aluminum foil.
 3. Bake until potatoes start to soften, 50-60 minutes. Remove foil and bake until potatoes are golden brown, 25-30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining â…“ cup Gruyere and â…“ cup parmesan. Bake until cheese is golden brown, 5-10 minutes.
ingredients: 3.5 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, sliced Â¼ inch thick

43.name: Grilled Shishito Recipe
43.instructions:
1. Wash and cut stems off from each Shishito pepper.
 2. Add oil to a frying pan and heat at low. Grill Shishito until soft and browned a little.
 3. Add sugar, Soy Sauce, and Sake, and stir so that Shishito is well-coated with the sauce. Then add Katuobushi and stir. Serve immediately.

44.name: Southern Potato Salad
44.instructions:
1. Cut each potato in half. Place in a large pot and cover with 1 inch of water. Add 2 teaspoons of salt and bring to a simmer. Simmer until fork can puncture easily, about 20 minutes. Drain well. Let cool then peel and discard the skins.
 2. Place potatoes in a large bowl. Run a knife through them until they are cut into bite-sized pieces.
 3. In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, sugar, and onion powder. Pour over potatoes and mix in well.
 4. Add relish, celery, onion, and the chopped eggs. Mix in.
 5. Add salt and pepper to taste.
 6. Top with sliced egg and sprinkle with paprika. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.

45.name: King Oyster Mushroom Rice Bowl
45.instructions:
1. Clean the mushrooms and cut into chunky pieces.
 2. Heat Oil in a large frying pan over medium high heat. Cook mushrooms until lightly browned, transfer to a plate and set aside.
 3. Lower the heat to low, add Sesame Oil, Ginger and Garlic, and cook stirring for a few minutes or until caramelized.
 4. Add Sugar, Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar and Sake (OR Water) and bring to the boil. Then add mushrooms and mix to combine.
 5. Mix Starch Flour with Water and add it gradually until the sauce thickens.
 6. Half fill a bowl with freshly cooked rice and cover it with the mushroom mixture. Sprinkle some finely chopped Spring Onion and Sesame Seeds on top.
ingredients: 1 tsp Corn starch, mixed with 1-2 tsp water

46.name: Roasted Mushroom Medley
46.instructions:
7. Preheat oven 400F
 8. Place mushrooms in baking pan, stir garlic into mushrooms.
 9. Drizzle oil,worcestershire, balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle oregano, salt, pepper. Toss.
 10. Roast, uncovered, for 20-25 minutes or until tender, stirring twice. Stir in parsley.

47.name: Cheesy Garlic Roasted Asparagus
47.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425Â°F. Lightly grease baking sheet.
 2. Arrange asparagus on sheet
 3. Drizzle olive oil on asparagus, and sprinkle garlic, salt, and black pepper on top.
 4. Mix with tongs
 5. Bake 10-15 minutes
 6. Add cheese.
 7. Broil until cheese is golden (about 4-5 minutes)
 8. Serve

48.name: Bacon Garlic Brussel Sprouts
48.instructions:
1. Start cooking the bacon on low heat until crispy.
 2. While bacon is cooking, prepare the Brussel sprouts. Cut off the bottom of each Brussel sprout and discard. Half each brussel sprout.
 3. Spead Brussel sprout halves on a baking tray.
 4. Cover with olive oil, black pepper, salt, and garlic powder. Toss to coat evenly.
 5. Bake at 350F until sprouts are bright green (about 10 minutes).
 6. Remove from oven and add garlic. 
 7. Bake at 350F again until the garlic has browned. Then remove from oven.
 8. Top with parmesan cheese and a few drops of lemon juice.
 9. Cut bacon into small pieces on top of the sprouts.
 10. Serve warm.
ingredients: 10 cloves Galic, chopped finely Olive oil Black pepper to taste Salt Garlic powder Parmesan cheese Lemon juice

49.name: Ruthâ€™s Chris Creamed Spinach
49.instructions:
1. Melt butter in a heavy medium saucepan over medium heat
 2. Add flour and stir until lightly golden, about 7 minutes
 3. Stir in onion, bay leaf, and garlic
 4. Gradually whisk in milk
 5. Whisk until mixture boils and thickens, about 10 minutes.
 6. Reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes longer, whisking frequently (sauce will be very thick)
 7. Remove bay leaf and whole clove
 8. Cook spinach in a large pot of boiling water just until wilted and tender, about 2 minutes
 9. Drain
 10. Transfer spinach to a bowl filled with ice water to cool
 11. Drain well
 12. Roll up spinach in a kitchen towel and squeeze out as much liquid as possible
 13. Finely chop spinach
 14. Add spinach to warm sauce, simmer over low heat until spinach is heated through, stirring often, about 5 minutes
 15. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter
 16. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve

50.name: Ebi Chili #1
50.instructions:
1. Clean shrimp with cornstarch and rinse under cold running water.
 2. Pat dry the shrimps with paper towel and place in a medium bowl. Add all the ingredients for marinade in the bowl and rub well.
 3. Mince ginger, garlic, and white part of green onion. 
 4. Heat oil in pan on medium heat. Cook shrimp until both sides change color. Turn off heat and transfer shrimp to a plate.
 5. Heat oil on medium heat and saute the green onion, ginger, and garlic until fragrant. Lower heat.
 6. Add chili bean paste, ketchup, chicken broth, sake, and sugar to the pan.
 7. Continue cooking for a few minutes on simmer. Return the shrimp to the pan and add the green part of green onion. Cook until shrimp is cooked through, stir occasionally.
 8. Add sesame oil and then pour cornstarch/water mixture to thicken the sauce. Stir well and remove from heat. Transfer to serving dish.

51.name: Ebi Chili #2
51.instructions:
1. Heat oil in skillet and stir fry ginger, garlic, and hot bean paste on low heat until oil becomes red
 2. Mix rest of ingredients (except corn starch and water) together and pour mixture int the skillet and bring to a boil on high heat
 3. Mix corn starch with water. Add mixture to skillet and sitr. Stop the heat.

52.name: Ginger Miso Sauce
52.instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients and mix well. Makes 2-3 servings.

53.name: Japanese Teriyaki sauce
53.instructions:
9. Combine shoyu, mirin, and sugar in small sauce pan.
 10. Add ginger and garlic.
 11. Heat on medium heat to boil.
 12. Turn to low and simmer for a few minutes.
 13. Remove from heat, allow to cool

54.name: Nacho Cheese Sauce
54.instructions:
1. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. (watch carefully. Once melted, the butter will brown quickly. Lower the heat to medium-low if starting to brown)
 2. Add the cornstarch and whisk or stir for about 1 minute over medium heat -- the mixture should be simmering. Slowly whisk in the milk and then add the spices.
 3. Cook, stirring regularly until slightly thickened, about 4 minutes. Remove from the heat, add the cheese, and stir until melted and smooth. Serve immediately.

55.name: Chili Pepper Water
55.instructions:
4. Combine all ingredients in medium bowl
 5. Chill
 6. Whisk well

56.name: Buttermilk Ranch Sauce
56.instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in medium bowl
 2. Chill
 3. Whisk well
 4. Chill

57.name: Kewpie Sesame Dressing
57.instructions:
1. Mix the Kewpie mayo and tahini together in a small dish.
 2. Add the mirin, shoyu, and sesame oil and mix until smooth.
 3. Refrigerate.

60.name: Bramble on Rose
ingredients: -1 Gray whale gin Giffard creme de framboise Honeydew mint

1.name: Hawaii Kalbi
1.instructions:
1. Rinse beef ribs to remove bone fragments and set aside.
 2. Mix water, shoyu, brown sugar, mirin, rice wine, sesame oil, black pepper, ginger, green onions, grated pear, grated kiwi, and garlic in a large bowl or blender.
 3. Put meat in a container or ziploc bag and add marinade to cover. Seal and refrigerate overnight or up to 3 nights.
 4. Broil meat on high until desired doneness is reached.
ingredients: 3 lbs Kalbi short rib of beef

2.name: Mochiko chicken
2.instructions:
1. Marinate the chicken by combining it with sugar, green onion, garlic, shoyu and salt in a container or ziploc bag. Let it marinate in the fridge overnight.
 2. In a bowl, mix flour, cornstarch, and eggs until the mixture has a batter-like consistency.
 3. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and dip them into the batter.
 4. Transfer the chicken pieces immediately to hot oil.
 5. Fry the chicken until brown.

3.name: Rafute (Okinawan braised pork belly)
3.instructions:
1. Wash the pork belly.
 2. Place the pork belly in a large pot and add cold water. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute, then discard the water.
 3. Rinse off any scum and foam from the pork, rinse the pot, and place the pork belly back in the pot. Fill it with cold water.
 4. Bring the pot to a boil, skim off any scum and foam, and reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook the pork uncovered for at least 1 to 1.5 hours. Add boiling water as needed to keep the pork fully covered.
 5. In a separate smaller pot, boil 4 cups of water. Add katsuobushi and let it simmer for 15 seconds. Turn off the heat and let the katsuobushi seep in the pot. Alternatively, you can use Hondashi soup stock to make the broth.
 6. Slice the ginger and cut it into thin strips. Soak them in water for 10-15 minutes to remove some spiciness. Drain well and set aside for garnishing later.
 7. After 1 to 1.5 hours of cooking the pork belly, transfer it to a plate and cover it with foil. Let it cool for about 5 minutes before slicing.
 8. Once the pork belly is cool enough to handle, slice it to the desired thickness and add it back to the pot.
 9. Strain the katsuobushi dashi into the pot with the pork belly.
 10. Add awamori, black sugar, and soy sauce to the pot, mixing the liquid to make sure the pork belly is fully covered with the sauce.
 11. Bring the pot to a gentle simmer, skim off any foam, and cover with a lid. Cook over medium-low heat for 2 hours, or until the pork is very tender and the skin/fat is gelatinous.
 12. Serve the pork belly on a plate and pour some of the braising liquid over it. Garnish with the ginger slices.
ingredients: 3 lbs Pork belly, boneless, skin on
3 cups Katsuobushi (dried bonito flakes) or Hondashi soup stock
1.5 cups awamori(okinawan distilled liquor, substitute with sake or vodka)
0.75 cups Black sugar(substitute with muscovado sugar)

4.name: Rotisserie Ham
4.instructions:
1. Bring pineapples, mustard and sugar to a boil.
 2. Lower heat to medium, reduce by â…“ about 4 to 6 minutes.
 3. Remove from heat. Stir in butter.
 4. Brush ham. Keep brushing while cooking.
 5. Ham needs to reach 140f internal temp at the thickest part.

5.name: Korokke
5.instructions:
1. Dice the onion and mince the garlic.
 2. In a mixing bowl, combine ground turkey, Worcestershire sauce, eggs, onion, and garlic.
 3. Add the dried spices to the turkey mixture and mix well.
 4. Mix the panko breadcrumbs into the mixture last.
 5. Form the mixture into meatballs.
 6. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
 7. Place the meatballs on a baking sheet or rack and bake for about 12 minutes or until desired browning is achieved.
 8. Done
 ________________
 title
 Korokke Image
 korokke1.jpg  Servings: 6
 Ingredients
 2 lb Russet potatoes (about 4 potatoes) 1   onion 1/2   carrot 2   Shiitake mushrooms 2 Tbsp oil 1 lb Ground beef 1 large Egg (50g w/o shell) 1 tsp salt 1/4 tsp White pepper powder 0   Black pepper 1/2 cup All-purpose flour 3 large eggs 2 cups panko 0   Tonkatsu sauce (for serving)   Directions To Make Korokke Patties
 1. Peel and cut potatoes into quarters, boil until soft, drain, and lightly mash.
 2. Finely chop onion, carrot, and shiitake mushrooms and sautÃ© in a skillet until soft.
 3. Add cooked meat, salt, white pepper, and black pepper to the skillet, cook until done, and drain.
 4. Mix the mashed potatoes and drained mixture together, add an egg, and combine.
 5. Shape the mixture into patties and refrigerate for 30 minutes to prevent them from exploding while frying.
 6. After 30 minutes, coat each patty with flour, egg, and panko, in that order.
 7. Cover with plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
 8. Deep fry Korokke until they are golden brown. The inside is already cooked, so all you need to do is to fry them until nicely brown.

6.name: Butter Chicken
6.instructions:
1. Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil, butter, and onions until golden, about 3-4 minutes. Add ginger and garlic and let cook for 30 seconds. Stir so it doesnâ€™t burn.
 2. Add chicken, tomato paste, and spices. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until everything is cooked.
 3. Add heavy cream and simmer for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve over rice.
ingredients: 1-1/2 lbs Boneless chicken breast, cut into Â¾ inch chunks
4 Tbsp Tomato paste (or 8oz can tomato sauce)

7.name: Buttermilk Fried Chicken Tenders
7.instructions:
1. Place chicken in a ziplock bag and pour the buttermilk into the bag. Squeeze air out and seal the bag. Let marinate in the fridge for 15-30 minutes.
 2. In a shallow bowl combine the panko, flour, baking powder, and spices.
 3. Remove the chicken strips from the buttermilk with a fork, shake off excess buttermilk, and dredge in the breadcrumb mixture to coat on all sides.
 4. Preheat the air fryer to 350 F if necessary.
 5. Put the chicken in the air fryer and air fry for 10-12 minutes, cook until the internal temperature reads 175F and the chicken tenders are golden brown and crispy.
 6. **Bonus** pause after 4 minutes and brush chicken with melted butter then turn it over and brush butter on the other side.
 7. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
ingredients: 3 Tbsp Melted butter, or oil spray

8.name: Meat Jun
8.instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine the first four ingredients and mix well until sugar has dissolved.
 2. Add meat to the marinade and cover with a plastic wrap or towel. Let it marinate in the fridge for 1-2 hours.
 3. After the meat has marinated, whisk eggs in a large bowl.
 4. Add enough flour to a plate to dredge the meat in.
 5. Heat and oil a non-stick pan over medium heat.
 6. Dredge the meat first in flour, then cover it in the whisked eggs.
 7. Quickly transfer the meat to the pan.
 8. Repeat the same process until the pan is slightly full.
 9. Cook the meat for 1-2 minutes or until the bottom becomes lightly golden brown.
 10. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
 11. Remove the meat from the pan after all sides have been cooked.
 12. For the dipping sauce, combine the remaining shoyu, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and gochujang or chili oil. Whisk to combine.
 13. Cut the meat into thin strips and serve with dipping sauce on the side.
 14. If you make a large batch, you can freeze it for up to one month.

9.name: Loco moco
9.instructions:
1. Chop the onion into small pieces.
 2. In a mixing bowl, combine the chopped onion with the ground beef.
 3. Add black pepper, garlic powder, and panko to the ground beef and mix thoroughly.
 4. Knead the meat mixture to ensure that all ingredients are well combined.
 5. Shape the meat mixture into about 5 patties of equal size.
 6. Heat a frying pan over medium-high heat.
 7. Fry the patties in the frying pan until they are browned on both sides, adding sliced mushrooms halfway through the cooking time.
 8. In a separate pan, sautÃ© the remaining chopped onion until softened and lightly browned.
 9. Make the loco moco gravy using your preferred recipe or mix.
 10. Fry the eggs over easy in a separate pan.
 11. To serve, place one cooked patty on a plate, then top with sautÃ©ed onions and a fried egg.
 12. Pour the loco moco gravy over the egg and patty.
 13. Repeat with the remaining patties, eggs, onions, and gravy as desired.
ingredients: 1 lb Ground beef Black pepper, to taste
2 Button mushrooms, sliced Loco moco gravy

10.name: Spam Cabbage
10.instructions:
1. Fry spam in a large pan until crispy.
 2. Add garlic to the pan and continue frying until crispy.
 3. Add cabbage, shoyu, onion, pepper, water, and oyster sauce to the pan.
 4. Bring the mixture to a boil and continue cooking until the cabbage is tender.
 5. If desired, mix in more oyster sauce before serving.
ingredients: 0 Pepper (enough to make lots of black spots)

11.name: Kalua Pig Cabbage
11.instructions:
1. Brown the Kalua Pork, and cook with onions until onions are glossy
 2. Add cabbage, shoyu, pepper, water, and garlic. Boil until the cabbage is soft.
 3. Add red chili pepper flakes to taste.
ingredients: 0 Pepper (enough to make lots of black spots)

12.name: Grandmaâ€™s Japanese Mabo Tofu
12.instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients except for the tofu and ground beef.
 2. Brown the ground beef in a separate pan.
 3. Add the sauce mixture to the ground beef and simmer in a pot over medium heat.
 4. Rinse the tofu and add it to the pot with the ground beef and sauce mixture.
 5. Stir the mixture to break up the tofu into smaller pieces.
 6. Add chicken stock or water as needed to adjust the consistency of the mixture.
 7. Season with salt to taste.
 8. Continue to simmer the mixture over low heat until the tofu has absorbed the flavors of the sauce and the mixture is heated through.
 9. Serve hot over rice or with your desired side dishes.
ingredients: 1 cup Chicken stock or water (1 tsp paste)

13.name: Zippyâ€™s Copycat Chili
13.instructions:
1. Blend the pochos sausage in a food processor until it matches the consistency of ground meat.
 2. Dice the onion, celery, and bell pepper into small pieces.
 3. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat a little bit of oil over medium-high heat and sautÃ© the diced onion, celery, and bell pepper until soft.
 4. Add the ground beef and pochos sausage to the pot and cook until just browned, breaking up any large chunks of meat with a wooden spoon or spatula.
 5. Add chili powder, cumin, oregano, and garlic to the pot and sautÃ© until fragrant, stirring constantly.
 6. Stir in the tomato paste, chicken broth, drained beans, Worcestershire sauce, and bay leaves. Give everything a good stir.
 7. Cover the pot and bring the mixture to a simmer over low heat.
 8. Let the mixture cook for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
 9. Remove the bay leaves from the pot.
 10. Serve hot with your desired toppings, such as grated cheese, sour cream, or chopped fresh cilantro.

14.name: Da Bes Hawaiian Beef Stew
14.instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
 2. Working in small batches in a single layer, brown the beef in the pot, making sure each piece is thoroughly caramelized. When all the meat is brown, set it aside in a bowl.
 3. In the same pot, add the chopped onion and brown it for about 3 minutes.
 4. Add the tomato paste to the pot and cook for 1 minute.
 5. Add the flour to the pot and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
 6. Add the 2 pounds of browned beef back into the pot, and season to taste with salt and coarse ground black pepper.
 7. Add a bay leaf to the pot.
 8. Add enough water so that the browned beef is just covered.
 9. Bring the mixture to a boil, then turn the heat down to medium-low and simmer covered for 2 hours.
 10. Add the carrots, potatoes, celery, diced tomato, and tomato sauce to the pot and continue to simmer until the vegetables are tender.
 11. Finish with some fresh cracked black pepper.
 12. Serve hot with rice and/or poi.

15.name: Beef Stew with Red Wine
15.instructions:
1. Cut any large pieces of stew meat into smaller bite-size pieces, if necessary.
 2. Combine the salt, rosemary, thyme, marjoram, paprika, and black pepper in a small bowl.
 3. Heat the oil in a large thick pot over medium-high heat.
 4. Add about half of the meat to the pan, or as much as you can without overcrowding.
 5. Sprinkle 2 teaspoons of the spice mixture over the meat and sautÃ© the beef until nicely browned.
 6. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the beef to a dish and set aside.
 7. Repeat with the remaining beef, adding additional oil if needed, and season with 2 more teaspoons of the spice mixture.
 8. Reserve remaining spice mixture for later.
 9. Add additional oil to the pan if needed and add the onion, celery, and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened.
 10. Add the tomato paste and stir until well combined.
 11. Add the red wine and increase the heat to bring mixture to a boil.
 12. Add the beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, remaining spice mix, and the bay leaf.
 13. Add the beef and all the juices that have accumulated back to the pot and bring to a boil.
 14. Reduce heat to LOW, cover, and simmer for 1.5 hours, or until the beef is fork tender.
 15. Add the potatoes and carrots and raise the heat to bring the liquid to a boil.
 16. Reduce the heat to LOW, cover, and simmer for another 30 to 40 minutes until the veggies are fork tender.
 17. Stir in the frozen peas and parsley.
 18. Combine the water and cornstarch in a measuring cup or small bowl and stir into the beef stew.
 19. Continue cooking uncovered, until thickened.
 20. Discard the bay leaf before serving.
ingredients: 1 cup Diced white or yellow onion
1 cup Medium to full-bodied red wine (Cabernet, Zinfandel, or Merlot)
1 lb Baby yellow or red potatoes, halved and quartered
1 cup Frozen peas, no need to thaw

16.name: Three Cheese Eggplant Lasagna
16.instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 375Â°F and spray a sheet pan with cooking spray.
 2. Cut the eggplants into 1/2-inch slices and brush 2 teaspoons of olive oil over the slices. Season with salt and pepper.
 3. Roast the eggplant slices in the oven for 15-20 minutes until tender and browned. If there is any excess moisture on the cooked eggplant, blot it dry with a paper towel.
 4. While the eggplant is roasting, prepare the sauce by heating olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
 5. Add ground beef to the pan and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 5-6 minutes, breaking the meat up with a spatula until browned and cooked through.
 6. Add onion to the pan and cook for another 3-4 minutes until softened. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
 7. Stir in marinara sauce and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes.
 8. In a separate bowl, combine ricotta cheese, Italian seasoning, egg, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper.
 9. Coat a 2 or 3 quart baking dish with cooking spray.
 10. Place 1/4 of the sauce in the bottom of the dish. Add 1/3 of the eggplant slices on top. Spread 1/3 of the ricotta mixture over the eggplant then top with 1/3 of the mozzarella cheese. Repeat the layers, ending with the mozzarella cheese.
 11. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
 12. Sprinkle with parsley, then let stand for 7-10 minutes. Cut into slices and serve.

17.name: Fettuccine alfredo
17.instructions:
1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water before draining.
 2. In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
 3. Pour heavy cream into the pan and stir to combine with the garlic and butter.
 4. Allow the cream to reduce for 5-8 minutes, stirring occasionally.
 5. Add half of the grated Parmesan cheese to the pan and whisk until melted and well combined.
 6. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and toss to coat the pasta evenly.
 7. Add the remaining Parmesan cheese to the pan and stir to combine.
 8. If the sauce is too thick, gradually add the reserved pasta water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.
 9. Serve immediately, garnished with additional grated Parmesan cheese and chopped parsley, if desired.

18.name: Spaghetti Sauce
18.instructions:
1. Season ground beef with salt and pepper.
 2. In a large skillet, brown the beef over medium-high heat. Drain excess grease.
 3. Add chopped onion to the skillet and saute until the onion is soft and translucent.
 4. Add tomato sauce, tomato paste, Italian seasoning, parsley, garlic powder, crushed red pepper, Worcestershire sauce, and sugar to the skillet.
 5. Stir well to combine all ingredients and bring to a boil.
 6. Add water and stir well.
 7. Reduce heat to low and let the sauce simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
 8. Add chopped basil to the sauce before serving, if desired.
ingredients: 0 Salt and black pepper, to taste
0 Crushed red pepper flakes, to taste

19.name: Stuffed Shells with Ricotta & Spinach
19.instructions:
1. Bring a pot of salted water to boil.
 2. Add spinach and cook until just wilted, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Use a slotted spoon to transfer spinach to colander to drain and cool slightly. (Keep water boiling).
 3. Place drained spinach leaves in a kitchen towel and wring out any excess liquid.
 4. Add pasta to the pot of boiling water and cook until al dente, 10 minutes or 1 minute less than package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
 5. In a large bowl, combine the ricotta with the pesto. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
 6. Roughly chop wilted spinach, and add to the mixture, stirring until combined.
 7. Chop 3 cloves of garlic. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm 2 tablespoons olive oil. When oil is hot, add garlic and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
 8. Add marinara sauce and pinch of chile flakes. Bring sauce to a simmer, and cook until the flavors combine, 6 minutes. Season to taste with salt.
 9. Stuff each shell with 1 tablespoon of filling.
 10. Nestle the filled shells into the marinara sauce.
 11. Cover and simmer until the shells are warmed through, 5 minutes.
 12. Pick the basil, discard the stems, and tear the leaves.
 13. Spoon the shells into shallow bowls, sprinkle with Parmesan and torn basil leaves, and serve warm.

20.name: Homemade Cheeseburger Macaroni
20.instructions:
1. Brown the ground beef in a large pot until it's no longer pink.
 2. Add the onions and cook until they're softened, which should take around 5 minutes.
 3. Add the tomato paste, seasonings, flour, and broth to the pot, stirring until they're combined.
 4. Pour in the milk and stir to incorporate it into the mixture.
 5. Add the macaroni to the pot, bringing it to a boil before reducing it to medium-low heat. Cover the pot and let it simmer for 10-12 minutes, or until the macaroni is cooked to your preferred level of doneness. Check it at 9 minutes for al dente.
 6. Once the macaroni is done, remove the pot from the heat and stir in the cheddar cheese until it's fully melted.
 7. Serve the dish immediately, optionally garnished with chopped fresh parsley.
ingredients: 2 cups Dried whole wheat elbow macaroni

21.name: Omurice
21.instructions:
1. Cut the chicken into bite-sized cubes and place it in a bowl. Pour shoyu over the chicken to marinate for 10-15 minutes.
 2. Crack the eggs into a separate bowl, add a pinch of salt and cream, and whisk the mixture together.
 3. Heat some oil in a pan over medium heat. Add sliced onions to the pan and sautÃ© until translucent and slightly browned.
 4. Increase the heat to medium-high and add the marinated chicken to the pan. Stir-fry the chicken until no raw sides are visible.
 5. Add cooked rice to the pan and break any clumps with a spatula. Continue to stir-fry for 2-3 minutes to warm the rice.
 6. Pour ketchup and oyster sauce over the rice and chicken mixture. Stir well to coat evenly and cook until the ketchup starts to caramelize, about 3-5 minutes. Add black pepper to taste.
 7. Plate the rice mixture in a serving bowl.
 8. In a separate pan, make an omelet with the egg mixture from step 2. Once cooked, place the omelet on top of the rice mixture.
 9. Serve hot and enjoy!

22.name: Miso Glazed Japanese Eggplant
22.instructions:
1. Slice the eggplant into rounds.
 2. Place the eggplant rounds in a colander and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 30 minutes to draw out excess water and reduce bitterness.
 3. In a small bowl, mix miso, mirin, and sugar to make a sauce. Set aside.
 4. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
 5. Add eggplant and fry until soft and lightly browned on both sides.
 6. Reduce heat to low, add the miso sauce to the pan and quickly stir to coat the eggplant evenly.
 7. Remove from heat and serve hot as a side dish or over rice.

23.name: Lionâ€™s mane crab cakes
23.instructions:
1. Shred the mushroom in a bowl.
 2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the egg, mayo, onion, Worcestershire sauce, paprika, Dijon mustard, parsley, salt, and pepper. Mix until all ingredients are well incorporated.
 3. Add the shredded mushrooms to the bowl and mix well.
 4. Stir in the panko breadcrumbs until the mixture is fully combined.
 5. Form the mixture into 3-4 patties, making them about Â½ to Â¾ inch thick.
 6. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.
 7. Place the patties in the pan and cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until they are golden brown and cooked throughout.
 8. Serve your delicious mushroom patties hot, and enjoy!

24.name: Roasted Beef Tenderloin with Beer Horseradish Sauce and Pilsner Mushrooms
24.instructions:
1. Make the Horseradish Sauce:
 * Use a small saucepan, combine the pilsner and horseradish. Bring to a low boil and reduce to a simmer.
 * Simmer for 5 minutes so that the alcohol cooks out, and then remove from heat. Let it cool for about 10 minutes.
 * In a small bowl, whisk together the beer and horseradish mixture, sour cream, salt and black pepper until smooth and creamy. Transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate until you are ready to serve.
 2. Cook the Beef Tenderloin:
 * Preheat the oven to 475 F.
 * Heat a large cast iron skillet over medium high heat.
 * Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper.
 * Once the pan is hot, add beef to the pan. Sear beef on all sides. Remove beef.
 * Lower heat and then add mushrooms. Cook for 4-6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
 * Add the beer and bring to a low boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and evaporate beer.
 * Add the beef back to the pan and place the entire pan into the oven.
 * Roast for 45-50 minutes until center is 120-125F for medium rare.
 * Remove pan from heat and remove beef from pan. Let the beef rest for 15 minutes, slice as desired.
 3. Serve:
 * Serve the sliced beef with the mushroom sauce on top or on the side.
ingredients: 00 Roasted Beef Tenderloin and Pilsner Mushrooms
2.5 cup Crimini mushrooms, halved and quartered

25.name: Comfort-food Breakfast Burrito
25.instructions:
1. Dice the onions, tomatoes, and jalapenos.
 2. Crumble the pork sausage and fry it in a pan until it becomes small pieces. Drain excess grease.
 3. Place the drained sausage in a frying pan, and add the diced onion, jalapenos, and tomatoes. Heat on medium until everything is heated through, stirring frequently.
 4. Beat 2 cups of eggs and add them to the pan with the sausage mixture. Cook until the eggs are done, then remove from heat.
 5. To assemble the breakfast burritos, place two tablespoons of the sausage and egg mixture onto each tortilla, add a portion of the torn American cheese on top, and roll the tortilla.
 6. You can wrap the burritos in plastic and store them in the fridge or freezer to heat up later in the microwave.
 7. Serve with your favorite taco or picante sauce and toppings such as avocado and sour cream.

26.name: Whole Wheat Burger/Hot Dog Buns
26.instructions:
Transform plain dough into buns that are way better than store-bought with these simple steps:
 1. Gather all the ingredients and line them up in the order that your bread machine requires.
 2. Put the ingredients in the bread machine, set the dough cycle, and let the machine work its magic. It's so easy that you'll have your dough ready in no time!
 3. Pour the dough out onto a lightly floured surface.
 4. Get your hands ready to shape the dough! Divide it into 8-10 pieces depending on whether you want hot dog or hamburger buns.
 5. Start shaping the dough into the desired shape of the bun you want.
 6. Place the buns on a greased cookie sheet and cover them up. Let them rise for 30 to 40 minutes, so they can get fluffy and bigger.
 7. Get your oven ready by preheating it to 375 degrees. Then bake the buns for 12-15 minutes, or until they turn a beautiful golden color.
 8. Last step, let your buns cool on a wire rack before slicing them open for the perfect hot dog or hamburger experience.
ingredients: 1 Tbsp Active dry yeast (or instant yeast)

27.name: Sourdough bread (1 lb loaf)
27.instructions:
1. Gather all your ingredients and mix them together in the bread machine.
 2. Set the machine to the French bread setting, and let it start mixing.
 3. After about 10 minutes of mixing, check the dough consistency. It should be smooth, slightly sticky, and pulling away from the sides of the bread machine. If the dough looks dry or crumbly, add a tablespoon of water at a time until it comes together.
 4. Let the bread machine finish its cycle, allowing the dough to rise and bake according to the French bread setting.
 5. Once the bread is done, carefully remove it from the bread machine and transfer it to a wire rack to cool.
 6. Slice and enjoy your freshly baked French bread with your favorite toppings and spreads.
ingredients: 0 *Replace water with oil for crustier bread

28.name: Banana Bread
28.instructions:
1. Melt a generous amount of butter in a saucepan over low heat. Allow it to cool for a few minutes before adding it to the mixture.
 2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, honey, and vanilla extract. Whisk them together until they are thoroughly combined.
 3. Gradually add the melted butter to the mixture and continue whisking until well mixed.
 4. Add a pinch of salt, a dash of baking soda, and a generous amount of flour. Whisk everything together until it forms a smooth batter.
 5. Mash up some ripe bananas and mix them into the batter to the desired chunkiness.
 6. Add a dollop of sour cream to give the batter some extra richness and creaminess.
 7. For a little extra spice, sprinkle some cinnamon on top of the batter.
 8. Grease a large loaf pan or cupcake pan with some butter or cooking spray to prevent sticking.
 9. Preheat your oven to 350 F and bake for approximately 1 hour. Check for doneness by inserting a toothpick into the center of the bread - it should come out clean when the bread is fully cooked. Enjoy your delicious banana bread!

29.name: Japanese Egg Sandwich (Tamago Sando)
29.instructions:
1. Cook the eggs
 * Put eggs in a medium saucepan and add enough water to cover by one inch.
 * Bring it to a boil on medium heat.
 * Once boiling, cook for 12 minutes.
 2. Prepare the egg salad
 * Transfer eggs to iced water to stop the cooking. Let them cool completely and peel the eggshells.
 * Transfer peeled eggs to a bowl and mash with a fork. Try to mash the egg whites into small, same-sized pieces.
 * Add sugar and salt.
 * Add black pepper and milk. Taste and add more salt and pepper if needed.
 * Add mayo and mix very well.
 3. Assemble the sandwich
 * Spread butter on the bread.
 * Evenly distribute the egg salad on one slice of bread.
 * Put another slice of bread on top, and place the sandwich between two plates to compress slightly. Set aside for 5 minutes.
 * Cut the bread crust off.
 * Cut the sandwich in half and eat.
 Enjoy your delicious egg salad sandwich!

30.name: Creamy Ham Potato and Corn Chowder
30.instructions:
1. Begin by melting 1.5 Tbsp of butter in a large pot over medium heat.
 2. Add the chopped onion, carrot, and celery, and saute for about 4 minutes until tender.
 3. Pour in the chicken broth and add the potatoes, oregano, thyme, and bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
 4. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to medium and cover with a lid. Allow the mixture to cook for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until the potatoes are nearly tender.
 5. Add the chopped ham and corn and continue to cook until the potatoes are fully tender, for an additional 5 minutes.
 6. In a medium saucepan, melt the remaining 4 Tbsp of butter over medium heat.
 7. Add flour and cook the mixture while stirring constantly for 1 Â½ minutes.
 8. Slowly add in milk while whisking vigorously to smooth lumps. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
 9. Bring the mixture to a boil, whisking constantly until it thickens.
 10. Remove the mixture from heat and stir in sour cream or heavy cream.
 11. Pour and stir the milk mixture into the soup (once the potatoes are fully tender).
 12. Serve the soup warm and topped with bacon and chives.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Sour cream or heavy cream

31.name: Butternut Squash Soup
31.instructions:
1. Prep the onion and garlic by dicing and mincing them respectively.
 2. SauteÃ© the onions and garlic in a large pot until the onions are shiny.
 3. Roughly chop the carrot and apple.
 4. Peel, seed, and cube the butternut squash. If the squash is hard, microwave it for a few minutes to soften.
 5. Add chicken broth, carrot, apple, butternut squash, sage, cayenne, cinnamon, and nutmeg to the pot.
 6. Simmer the ingredients for 20-30 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
 7. Remove and discard the sage.
 8. Lower the heat and add coconut milk.
 9. Use an immersion blender to pureÃ© the soup until smooth, taking care to avoid splashing hot soup.
 10. Add salt and pepper to taste when serving.

32.name: Curry Udon
32.instructions:
1. To begin, thinly slice the onion and green onions. Next, chop the carrots and potatoes into small cubes.
 2. In a pot, sautÃ© the onion in some oil until it becomes translucent. Add the ground beef and cook until it is almost browned.
 3. Once the beef is almost fully cooked, add in some dashi, along with the chopped carrots and potatoes. Continue to cook until the vegetables become tender.
 4. While the vegetables are cooking, start boiling water in a large pot for the udon noodles. Once the vegetables are tender, turn the heat down to low.
 5. Next, add the curry roux in a ladle or large spoon, and use the hot stock to dissolve the roux into the soup. Mix well until the roux has completely dissolved, then turn off the heat.
 6. Add shoyu to the soup and mix well. When the water in the other pot has come to a boil, cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions.
 7. Once the noodles are done cooking, divide them into two bowls. Pour the curry soup over the udon noodles and top with the sliced green onions. Serve immediately and enjoy!

33.name: Ozoni
33.instructions:
1. Start by peeling and slicing the daikon and carrots. You want them to be thin and about the same size for even cooking.
 2. In a large pot, bring the dashi to a boil over medium heat. Once it's boiling, add the chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes until it's no longer pink inside. Be sure to skim any foam or fat that rises to the surface.
 3. Remove the chicken from the pot and set it aside to cool. Keep the dashi on the stove.
 4. Add the sliced daikon and carrots to the pot with the dashi. Continue cooking on medium heat until they're soft and tender. This should take about 10-15 minutes.
 5. In a separate saucepan, blanch the spinach for a minute or two. Then, remove it from the heat and place it in cold water to stop the cooking process.
 6. Once the daikon and carrots are soft, add miso to the soup. Start with 3 tablespoons and adjust to your desired taste. Be sure to stir the miso in well so that it fully dissolves.
 7. Add the tofu to the soup and continue cooking for a few minutes until it's heated through.
 8. Toast the mochi until it's golden brown on both sides. You can do this in a toaster oven or on a griddle.
 9. To serve, place the toasted mochi in the bottom of a bowl. Add a few pieces of chicken and a handful of blanched spinach. Then, pour the miso soup over the top. Garnish with green onions or sesame seeds if you like. Enjoy!

34.name: Potato Ham Chowder
34.instructions:
1. Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crispy. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the bacon to a paper towel-lined plate, and set aside.
 2. Melt the butter in a pot over medium heat. Once melted, add the garlic and onion, stirring frequently until they are translucent.
 3. Add the corn and thyme to the pot, and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
 4. Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute.
 5. Gradually whisk in the milk, stirring constantly until the mixture is thickened, about 1-2 minutes.
 6. Stir in the potatoes and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat and let it simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 12-15 minutes.
 7. Stir in the ham and add salt and pepper to taste. If the chowder is too thick, you can add more milk to achieve the desired consistency.
 8. Garnish with the crispy bacon and serve hot. This delicious and comforting chowder is perfect for a cozy night in or a comforting meal on a cold day.

35.name: Spicy Tan Tan Ramen
35.instructions:
1. Make the tare by whisking together all the tare ingredients and setting it aside.
 2. In a medium pot, simmer water, milk, and chicken powder for 5 minutes. In another pot, bring water to a boil.
 3. In a large pan over high heat, stir fry chili oil, garlic, and ginger for 30 seconds. Add chili bean paste and oyster sauce, stir fry for another 45 seconds to 1 minute, then add ground pork and stir fry until cooked, which should take about 1 minute. Add rice wine and stir fry for another 3 to 4 minutes, or until there's no moisture left.
 4. Blanch bok choy and bean sprouts in salted boiling water for 1 minute and 2 minutes, respectively.
 5. Cook the noodles in the same boiling water for 2 to 3 minutes.
 6. Combine half of the tare and half of the hot broth in a serving bowl.
 7. Drain the noodles and add them to the serving bowl.
 8. Top with blanched bok choy and bean sprouts, stir-fried pork, extra chili oil (if desired), ramen egg, chopped green onions, sesame seeds, and sansyo powder.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp Chili oil or regular cooking oil
1 Tbsp Toban djian (Chinese chili bean paste)
2 tsp Chicken bouillon FOR NOODLES & TOPPINGS

36.name: Miso Soup
36.instructions:
1. Fill a pot with water and bring it to a boil. Once the water starts boiling, add dashi powder to the pot. Stir well until the powder dissolves completely.
 2. Peel and slice the small daikon and add it to the pot. Let it boil for about 5 minutes or until the daikon is soft and translucent. Make sure to adjust the heat if needed to maintain a gentle boil.
 3. Reduce the heat to medium-low and add tofu to the pot. Let it cook for 3 more minutes. This will give the tofu time to absorb the flavor of the broth and soften slightly.
 4. In a separate bowl, add miso and a small amount of broth from the pot. Mix well until the miso has completely dissolved. Then, add the miso mixture back to the pot and stir gently to combine.
 5. Turn off the heat and add negi when serving. Chop the negi into small pieces and sprinkle them on top of the soup before serving. This will give the dish a fresh and aromatic flavor. Serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients: 4 Tbsp Awase miso (half white, half red)

37.name: Garlic Broccolini
37.instructions:
1. Start by preparing the broccolini. Rinse the broccolini under cool water and shake off any excess water. Then, using a sharp knife, trim about Â½ inch off the bottom of the stems. This will ensure that the broccolini cooks evenly.
 2. Heat up a large skillet over medium-high heat until the oil is shimmering. You want the pan to be hot so that the broccolini cooks quickly and develops a nice char. Once the pan is hot, add the broccolini to the skillet and sautÃ© for 5-7 minutes, or until the broccolini is bright green and some stems and tops of the florets are lightly charred.
 3. Add the garlic, salt, and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Stir the ingredients together and continue to sautÃ© until the garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds. Be careful not to let the garlic burn, as this can give your dish a bitter taste.
 4. Pour in the water and quickly cover the skillet with a lid. Cook until the broccolini is vibrant green and crisp-tender, which should take about 1 to 2 minutes. The water will help steam the broccolini and make it tender.
 5. Once the broccolini is cooked to your liking, remove the skillet from the heat. Serve immediately with lemon wedges on the side. The lemon wedges add a fresh and bright flavor to the dish, which complements the earthy flavor of the broccolini.

38.name: Hawaii Mac Salad
38.instructions:
1. Cook the macaroni according to the package instructions until it's al dente. Drain it in a colander and rinse it under cold water to cool it down.
 2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mayonnaise, milk, white vinegar, grated carrots, and sugar. Mix the ingredients until they are well combined.
 3. Add the cooled macaroni to the mixing bowl and gently stir it into the mayonnaise mixture until the macaroni is evenly coated.
 4. Add salt and pepper to taste, and stir to combine.
 5. Cover the mixing bowl with a lid or plastic wrap and refrigerate it for at least 4 hours, or overnight if possible. This will allow the flavors to meld together and will make for a tastier salad.
 6. Before serving, give the macaroni salad a quick stir and taste it again to see if you need to add more salt or pepper. Serve it cold, with a splash of shoyu on top if desired.
 Enjoy your delicious macaroni salad!

39.name: Stir-fry garlic green beans
39.instructions:
1. Rinse the green beans with cold water and pat them dry with a paper towel.
 2. In a small bowl, mix together the shoyu and white wine.
 3. Prepare the garlic by peeling and mincing 2-3 cloves. Peel and finely chop 1 tablespoon of fresh ginger.
 4. In a large skillet or wok, heat the pan over medium-high heat until one drop of water evaporates in 1-2 seconds.
 5. Swirl 1-2 tablespoons of oil in the pan. You can use vegetable oil, canola oil, or any oil with a high smoke point.
 6. Add the minced garlic and chopped ginger to the pan and stir-fry for 8 seconds or until fragrant.
 7. Add the green beans to the pan and toss them in the shoyu and wine mixture.
 8. Continue to stir-fry the green beans for 5-7 minutes or until they are cooked to your desired texture. If the pan seems dry, you can add a splash of water to create some steam.
 9. When the green beans are cooked to your liking, remove the pan from the heat.
 10. Sprinkle some red pepper flakes on top for a bit of heat and extra flavor.
 11. Serve hot as a side dish or as part of a larger meal.
 Enjoy your delicious stir-fried green beans!

40.name: French Green Beans with Butter Sauce and Crispy Leeks
40.instructions:
1. Begin by heating 1 inch of oil in a heavy pot over medium heat until it reaches a temperature of 350F. It's important to use a heavy pot to ensure even heat distribution and to prevent the pot from tipping over due to the weight of the oil.
 2. While the oil is heating, prepare the leeks by cutting them into rounds and washing them thoroughly to remove any dirt or debris. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, Â¼ tsp salt, and pepper. This will create a seasoned flour mixture that will coat the leeks and help them develop a crispy exterior.
 3. In another bowl, pour some buttermilk. The acidity in the buttermilk will help tenderize the leeks and also create a creamy texture when combined with the flour coating. Dip the leek rounds in the buttermilk, then dredge them in the seasoned flour mixture until they are fully coated.
 4. Once the oil has reached 350F, carefully add the coated leeks to the pot, being sure not to overcrowd the pot. Fry the leeks until they are golden and crispy, which should take about 1 minute. Use a slotted spoon or tongs to remove the leeks from the oil and transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
 5. Now it's time to prepare the butter sauce. In a separate pot over medium heat, combine the white wine, vinegar, celery, chopped leeks, remaining Â¼ tsp salt and pepper, and sugar. This will create a flavorful base for the sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil and allow it to cook until the liquid is reduced by two-thirds. This will help concentrate the flavors and create a thicker sauce.
 6. Once the liquid has reduced, whisk in the butter until it's fully incorporated into the sauce. This will create a rich, velvety texture that will complement the crispiness of the leeks and the freshness of the green beans.
 7. To assemble the dish, transfer the steamed green beans to a platter. Drizzle the butter sauce over the green beans, making sure to coat them evenly. Finally, top the green beans with the fried leeks, which will add a delicious crunch and a savory flavor.

41.name: Hasselback Potato Gratin
41.instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350F to ensure that it's hot and ready to go when you need it.
 2. Lightly grease a 3 quart baking dish to ensure that the potato gratin doesn't stick to the sides or bottom of the dish during baking. You can use a non-stick spray or butter to grease the dish.
 3. In a large bowl, combine the onions, cream, garlic, thyme, rosemary, 1 â…” cups of Gruyere cheese, and â…” cup of parmesan cheese. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
